ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class provides a good survey of the literature and film made in the Post-Stalin era through the present day, covering both official and unofficial literature. Because this is a time period with many different movements and a lot of creativity, it is obviously impossible to cover everything in one semester. However, I think this course does a good job of providing an overview of this period. I would recommend this course to a student interested in studying the literature of this time period, because I think that there was a good mix of mainstream and more obscure works, some of which I and others had never had the chance to read or see.

The course is a survey of Russian literature post 1945. There is a lot of focus on the earlier section of this time period, so very contemporary literature gets swallowed a bit by the end of the semester. I would recommend the course, and the syllabus contains a number of important texts and films.
I would definitely recommend the course to a fellow student, particularly if one wants an overview of literature and cinema of the period.
I would definitely recommend the course to another student, with the caveat that they can easily read large amounts in Russian. Not a suitable course for MA students.
Definitely recommend taking this course to any student, even non-Slavic majors

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes, the course deepened my knowledge. It provided a good foundation in modern Russian texts, but I would have preferred more focus on literature and less on film.
It most definitely proved helpful for my discipline/profession as it deepened my knowledge of literature of the period as well as contemporary Russian film.
This course definitely deepened my knowledge of the discipline, and I expect that it will very much influence my future research.
